etymologies: mid 16th century. From Middle French rebaptization and its etymon post-classical Latin rebaptization-, rebaptizatio from classical Latin re- + post-classical Latin baptizatio

definitions: The action or practice of baptizing a person again; (also as a count noun) a second baptism; a rebaptism.

notes.text: In early use frequently with reference to the view, held by St Cyprian and opposed by Pope Stephen I, that those baptized by heretics should be baptized again before being admitted to the Church.
